title: 108_hr3902
content: The Act may be cited as the "Musconetcong Wild and Scenic Rivers Act". Congress finds that the Secretary of the Interior is conducting a study of the Musconetcong River in New Jersey for inclusion in the Wild and Scenic Rivers System. A river management plan has been prepared to ensure long-term protection of the river's values and resources. Thirteen municipalities and three counties are involved in the study area. Thirteen municipalities and three counties along segments of the Musconetcong River support the River Management Plan and endorse the designation of the river. Designation of portions of Musconetcong River, New Jersey, as scenic and recreational rivers. Designation of 24.2 miles of Musconetcong River in New Jersey as scenic and recreational rivers, to be administered by the Secretary of the Interior. The segments include a scenic river from Saxton Falls to the Route 46 bridge and a recreational river from the Kings Highway bridge to the railroad tunnels at Musconetcong Gorge. The river segments will not be part of the National Park System. The Secretary of the Interior will manage these segments. The Interior will manage designated segments of the Musconetcong River in New Jersey in accordance with the "Musconetcong River Management Plan" prepared by various organizations. The Secretary will cooperate with different agencies for the management of the river segments. The Musconetcong River in New Jersey will be managed according to the "Musconetcong River Management Plan" prepared by various organizations including the Musconetcong River Management Committee, Musconetcong Watershed Association, Heritage Conservancy, National Park Service, and New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection. The plan will satisfy the requirements for a comprehensive management plan under the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act. The Federal government will assess proposed water resource projects to prevent adverse effects on designated river segments. The Secretary will consider project consistency with the management plan for designated river segments under the Wild and Scenic Rivers System. Cooperative agreements must align with the management plan and may include US assistance. The Secretary can provide support for plan implementation through technical assistance, staff support, and funding. The Secretary may provide planning, financial, and technical assistance to local municipalities and non-profit organizations for implementing actions to protect natural and historic resources of river segments. Zoning ordinances of municipalities bordering the segments will be considered to satisfy standards under the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act after adoption of recommendations in the management plan. Congress finds the Musconetcong River segment "C" suitable for designation. The Secretary may designate segment "C" as a recreational river if there is local support. If designated, it will be administered according to the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act. The Secretary will consider local government preferences in determining adequate support for designating the additional Musconetcong River segment. Funds are authorized for implementing this section, including amendments to the Wild and Scenic River Act. Definitions include the additional river segment from Hughesville Mill to the Delaware River Confluence and the management plan for the Musconetcong River. The "Musconetcong River Management Plan" from April 2002 designates river segments in New Jersey as scenic or recreational rivers. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior.
